title: To facilitate the sale of United States agricultural products to Cuba, as authorized by the Trade Sanctions Reform and Export Enhancement Act of 2000.
content: Agricultural Export Facilitation Act of 2007 - Amends the Trade Sanctions Reform and Export Enhancement Act of 2000 to require the Secretary of the Treasury to authorize, under a general license, certain travel-related transactions for travel to, from, or within Cuba in connection with: (1) sales and marketing activities, including organization and participation in product exhibitions. And (2) sea or air transportation of products. Authorizes a consular official to issue a temporary touristbusiness visa for a Cuban national whose itinerary documents an intent to conduct activities, including phytosanitary inspections, related to purchasing US agricultural goods under the provisions of TSREEA of 2000. Defines payment in cash with respect to certain prohibitions on financing of US agricultural sales to Cuba. Prohibits the President from restricting direct transfers from a Cuban financial institution to a US financial institution executed in payment for a product authorized for sale under TSREEA of 2000.
